entry.title: Simethicone (Gas-X) for Pets | PetPlace.com
entry.summary: Simethicone, commonly known as Gas-X, is a an anti-foaming and anti-flatulent agent used to treat discomfort, pain, bloating, burping, and flatulence caused by excessive intestinal gas, that can be used in dogs and cats.

entry.title: Potential Thanksgiving Dangers for Your Pet | PetPlace.com
entry.summary: Excluding your pet from the Thanksgiving festivities is out of the question, but be sure to keep them away from dangerous food, hot ovens & unruly guests.

entry.title: My Cat is Licking Her Fur Off, What Do I Do? - PetPlace
entry.summary: If your cat is licking her fur off, it's certainly concerning. What causes it and what can you do? There are several reasons cats lick their fur.

entry.title: Bernese Mountain Dog - PetPlace
entry.summary: The Bernese Mountain Dog is a protective pooch that enjoys family, fun & affection. Here's everything you need to know about this larger-than-life breed.

entry.title: How to Induce Vomiting (Emesis) in Cats - PetPlace
entry.summary: If your cat ingests something toxic, you may want to avoid the risk and induce vomiting. Here are safe methods to induce vomiting (emesis) in cats.

entry.summary: Exotic cats are beautiful to look at, but do they make for good pets? Here are some of the risks and rewards of owning an exotic feline.

entry.title: What to Do if Your Cat Has a Urinary Tract Infection - PetPlace
entry.summary: Issues of the feline urinary tract are amongst the most common cat health problems. They may include urinary tract infections and idiopathic cystitis.

entry.summary: The rare and beautiful Russian Blue cat boasts an air of mystery, vivid green eyes, and silver-blue coat. We discuss their history, personality, and health.

entry.title: How to Control Excessive Shedding in Cats
entry.summary: Shedding in cats is normal however excessive shedding is not. Learn more about shedding in cats and what you can do about excessive shedding.

entry.title: What to Do with a Cat Ear Infection
entry.summary: Cat ear infections are common and can involve the outer ear or the inner ear. They can be caused by ear mites, bacteria, and/or yeast organisms.

entry.title: What to Do with a Cat Flea Infection
entry.summary: Cat fleas are very common and an extremely annoying problem in cats. Learn more about how to identify cat fleas and about the best treatment options.

entry.summary: Tail trauma is an occasional problem mainly found in outdoor cats. Learn more about how to recognize the signs of tail trauma in cats and what to do here.

entry.title: Kidney Failure in Cats
entry.summary: Kidney failure in cats can be categorized into two types — acute kidney failure and chronic kidney failure. Learn more about each of these conditions here.

entry.title: Yunnan Baiyao for Dogs and Cats
entry.summary: Yunnan Baiyao is available without a prescription but should not be administered unless under the supervision and guidance of a veterinarian. Learn more about yunnan baiyao for dogs and cats here.

entry.title: Akita - PetPlace
entry.summary: The protective and striking Akita is known for its unwavering loyalty. Find out more about this fascinating dog in our breed guide.

entry.title: Alaskan Malamute Breed Guide - PetPlace
entry.summary: The beautiful and bold Alaskan Malamute possesses an incredible endurance and loyalty, making it suited for both labor and family companionship.

entry.title: American Staffordshire Terrier - PetPlace
entry.summary: American Staffordshire Terriers were once warriors, but are now best suited for family life & brisk exercise. Our breed guide examines them head to toe.

entry.title: Anatolian Shepherd - PetPlace
entry.summary: The Anatolian Shepherd dog is the best of both worlds, offering protection and devotion in equal measure. We review the breed's unique history and look.

entry.title: Bichon Frise Dog Breed Characteristics | PetPlace.com
entry.summary: Those looking for an affectionate family dog need look no further than the Bichon Frise breed. We review their distinctive look, personality, and history.

entry.title: Beauceron Breed Characteristics and Care | PetPlace.com
entry.summary: Don't let their appearance fool you. Beauceron are devoted family pets, as known for their affection as they are for police and guard work.

entry.title: Basset Hound - PetPlace
entry.summary: The Basset Hound is a laidback hunter with a nose for sniffing out prey. Our breed guide details this dog's pedigree & current role as family pet.

entry.title: Belgian Malinois: Notable Traits and Tail Characteristics | PetPlace.com
entry.summary: Explore the versatile Belgian Malinois breed. Discover tail characteristics and more. Unearth the details now!

entry.title: Australian Cattle Dog - PetPlace
entry.summary: An expert herder with a deep devotion to family, the Australian Cattle Dog is a unique breed that pairs a wolf's endurance with a Dalmatian's loyalty.

entry.title: Boerboel - PetPlace
entry.summary: Looking for a dog specifically bred to protect your family & home? The Boerboel is not only the perfect guardian, but also an affectionate companion.

entry.title: Bloodhound - PetPlace
entry.summary: Bloodhounds are exceptional trackers that make even better household companions. Learn more about this endearing and beloved dog in our breed guide.

entry.title: Border Collie - PetPlace
entry.summary: Border Collies are smart herding dogs in need of activity and exercise. Our breed guide examines their history, health, and amazing abilities.

entry.title: Boston Terrier: Guide to Care and Temperament | PetPlace.com
entry.summary: Looking for a well-mannered canine companion that loves to cuddle? The Boston Terrier is right up your alley. Check out our guide for care tips & traits.

entry.title: Clumber Spaniel - PetPlace
entry.summary: Looking for a laidback family dog that's built for snuggles? The Clumber Spaniel is a large-breed made for quiet time with affectionate families.

entry.title: Cocker Spaniel - PetPlace
entry.summary: Boisterous, beautiful, and family friendly, the Cocker Spaniel is a dog breed suited for every type of family and living space.

entry.title: Coton de Tulear - PetPlace
entry.summary: These soft & snuggly dogs are relatively new to the US, but they've built up quite a reputation. We discuss the unique Coton de Tulear look & demeanor.

entry.title: English Bulldog - PetPlace
entry.summary: English Bulldogs are lovable couch potatoes that are devoted to their owners. Our breed guide details their history, body type, appearance, and personality.

entry.title: Great Dane - PetPlace
entry.summary: The immensity of the Great Dane makes them a fascinating and formidable family pet. We review this dog breed's history, personality, and overall health.

entry.title: Great Pyrenees - PetPlace
entry.summary: The Great Pyrenees has been everything from a hunter to a nobleman. Our breed guide details this dog's history, look & personality.

entry.title: Irish Wolfhound - PetPlace
entry.summary: Originally bred as hunters, the Irish Wolfhound has softened over time & developed into a loving companion. Here's a look at this larger-than-life breed.

entry.title: Jack Russell Terrier - PetPlace
entry.summary: Smart & high-energy, the Jack Russell Terrier is built for active families with older children. We take a comprehensive look at this unique dog breed.

entry.title: Labrador Retriever - PetPlace
entry.summary: Extremely devoted & exceptionally skilled, the Labrador Retriever has spent over 25 years atop the AKC's Most Popular Dog Breeds list for good reason.

entry.title: Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retriever - PetPlace
entry.summary: Looking for an affectionate and outgoing dog to match your active lifestyle? The Nova Scotia Duck Tolling Retriever has a long name and loads of energy.

entry.title: Papillon - PetPlace
entry.summary: The Papillon is a breed of noble heritage that can fit any lifestyle and living space. We investigate their royal background and adorable appearance.

entry.title: Maltese - PetPlace
entry.summary: Maltese are loyal lapdogs that love quality time with their families. Our breed guide details their royal history, adorable appearance & winning attitude.

entry.title: Pomeranian Dog Breed Traits and Care | PetPlace.com
entry.summary: The tiny, but regal, Pomeranian is a lap dog with royal origins. Our breed guide details their history, body type, appearance, and personality.

entry.title: Health and Care Needs of the Samoyed Dog Breed | PetPlace.com
entry.summary: Known for thick, white coats & smiling faces, the Samoyed is a large-breed dog with a larger-than-life personality. We break down their look and history.

entry.title: Shar Pei - PetPlace
entry.summary: A fighting dog with ancient origins, the Shar Pei has developed into a companion animal, fueled by the overwhelming cuteness of their signature wrinkles.

entry.title: Shiba Inu: Breed History, Diet, and Behavior | PetPlace
entry.summary: Shiba Inu are brave and beautiful Japanese watchdogs. Our breed guide details their history, body type, appearance, and personality.

entry.title: Shih Tzu - PetPlace
entry.summary: Shih Tzu are sweet and smart family dogs of royal descent. Our breed guide details their history, body type, appearance, and personality.

entry.title: Guide to Care and Body Type of a Standard Schnauzer | PetPlace.com
entry.summary: Defined by their majestic beards and salt & pepper coat, the Standard Schnauzer is an instantly recognizable and endlessly fascinating dog breed.

entry.title: Vizsla - PetPlace
entry.summary: Loyal, athletic, and full of energy, the Vizsla dog breed is perfect for a family on the go. We review their physical build, personality traits & history.

entry.title: Weimaraner - PetPlace
entry.summary: An expert hunter and playful companion, the Weimaraner is a dog breed that's the best of both worlds for close-knit, active families.

entry.title: Yorkshire Terrier - PetPlace
entry.summary: The Yorkshire Terrier is an adorable and high-energy family dog. Our breed guide details their history, body type, appearance, and personality.
